choices.E: Configure an SD-WAN rule to load balance all traffic without VoIP.
choices.B: Choose the suitable interface based on the interface cost and weight.
choices.D: Place the troublesome link at the top of the interface preference list.
choices.C: Use the performance SLA targets to detect latency and jitter instantly.
choices.A: Select the corresponding SD-WAN balancing strategy in the SD-WAN rule.

questions.question_text:
An administrator is troubleshooting VoIP quality issues that occur when calling external phone numbers. The SD-WAN interface on the edge FortiGate is configured with the default settings, and is using two upstream links. One link has random jitter and latency issues, and is based on a wireless connection.
Which two actions must the administrator apply simultaneously on the edge FortiGate to improve VoIP quality using SD-WAN rules? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
AC to SD-WAN_6.4_Study_Guide page 55

Selected Answer: AC
B is not correct, because you must choose the interface manually, is not a suitable options if you configure a IP SLA, so the correct answer is A C

comments.content:
A & C
Performance SLA can do the interface selection for you without the need for human intervention. B cant be correct.

choices.B: Dead members require manual administrator access to bring them back alive.
choices.D: SD-WAN interface becomes disabled and port1 becomes the WAN interface.
choices.A: Port2 might become alive when a single response is received from an SLA server.
choices.C: Subnets 100.64.1.0/24 and 172.20.0.0/16 are reachable only through port1.

questions.question_text: What are two roles that SD-WAN orchestrator plays when it works with FortiManager? (Choose two.)

choices.B: It acts as a standalone device to assist FortiManager to manage SD-WAN interfaces on the managed FortiGate devices.
choices.D: It acts as an application that is released and signed by Fortinet to run as a part of management extensions on FortiManager.
choices.A: It configures and monitors SD-WAN networks on FortiGate devices that are managed by FortiManager.
choices.C: It acts as a hub FortiGate with an SD-WAN interface enabled and managed along with other FortiGate devices by FortiManager.

discussion.content: SD-Wan Orchestrator is EOL. It doesnÂ´t appears in NSE7 Study Guide 6.4.5 nor 7.x .

choices.D: It uses route tags for a BGP community and assigns the SD-WAN rules with same tag.

choices.B: Configure at least one firewall policy for SD-WAN traffic.
choices.C: Specify the outgoing interface routing cost.
choices.D: Specify the incoming interfaces in SD-WAN rules.

questions.question_text: Which two configuration tasks are required to use SD-WAN? (Choose two.)
